item.title: .NET 6 is now in Ubuntu 22.04
item.description: .NET 6 is now included in Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy) and can be installed with just `apt install dotnet6`.
item.author: (Richard Lander)

item.title: What's New in Visual Studio 2022 17.4 Preview 1
item.description: We released Visual Studio 2022 17.4 Preview 1 last week alongside the 17.3 generally available release. In this post we’ll share details about some of the new capabilities in this preview and the focus of this release. Feedback from developers like you during our preview cycle is so important for us to deliver a final product that meets your high expectations.
item.author: (Marc Goodner)

item.description: Japan Dev started as a list of companies I wanted to work for back in 2014. Here's the story of how that idea morphed into a job board showcasing hundreds of Japan's best tech companies.

item.title: Malicious PyPi packages aim DDoS attacks at Counter-Strike servers
item.description: A dozen malicious Python packages were uploaded to the PyPi repository this weekend in a typosquatting attack that performs DDoS attacks on a Counter-Strike 1.6 server.
item.author: (Bill Toulas)

item.title: Cloudflare Support Portal gets an overhaul
item.description: The Cloudflare Support team has launched a new Support Portal. The portal will give you access to self-help resources, diagnostics with troubleshooting guides, and will provide for easier ticket submission

item.title: How Discord Supercharges Network Disks for Extreme Low Latency
item.description: It's no secret that Discord's your place to talk; 4 billion messages sent a day have us convinced. But text only accounts for a chunk of the features that Discord supports — learn how Discord optimizes its platform to respond to the high frequency of queries for all types of content and data as quickly as possible.

item.title: Win32 Is The Only Stable ABI on Linux
item.description: In ELF format there are two ways of providing a hash table of symbols. DT_HASH and DT_GNU_HASH. The first one is part of SYSV generic ABI and is well documented and marked as mandatory. DT_GNU_HASH is a newer, smaller, and faster replacement that is not documented, implemented in a few places (Glibc, GNU ld, Musl, LLVM, mold, etc.) and a subject of a couple of blog posts that I’ve found. Turns out it also doesn’t provide the same functionality as DT_HASH. To get the number of symbols you have to completely parse it.
item.author: (2022-08-15, by ivyl)
